channel.title: [PI] adding models
channel.description: Ok, I am trying to enter a dragon platebody into my servers, first problem, where do i put the .rar files, I heard you put them in a raw folder that your supposed to make but i dont know if this is right, second problem, the ints are made for a class8 and i know PI uses itemdef, so how do I enter these so they are compatible? If im missing a step please let me know, any help anyone?

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Thanks, I found a model for converting class8 to itemdef in pastebin ;D

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Get Blitz:

First few are how good the item is and then the rest are bonuses like str mage etc like when you equip it. also i am not sure about your folders and if you have itemdef.java you gotta convert the ints

ok, so for the ints just put itemdef. infront off all of them?

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Get Blitz, post:7, topic:413624”]1. No you don’t make a raw folder, Do you have a Models folder?

  1. No, You should have a itemdef.java or itemdef2.java and put the ints in there if not then i am not sure

  2. in item.cfg you should have a lot of items just copy one and pase it then change the name and other stuff etc.[/quote]
    1.No models no raw

2.here are my ints:if(i == 13665) // change this if you need to "item number" { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = 14106;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = 14106;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }
3. I know but for example, one of my items goes like this:
item = 946 Knife A_dangerous_looking_knife. 6 6 6 0…
what do the numbers mean?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

  1. No you don’t make a raw folder, Do you have a Models folder?

  2. No, You should have a itemdef.java or itemdef2.java and put the ints in there if not then i am not sure

  3. in item.cfg you should have a lot of items just copy one and pase it then change the name and other stuff etc.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Get Blitz, post:5, topic:413624”]First you Extract the .rar and what you get should be a .dat put that in your cache in the folder named Models or Raw.

Then you go into you Client files and go into itemdef.java, You will need the ints which will most likely be provided with the model.

Last step add the item in item.cfg and adjust the bonuses etc[/quote]
do i make a raw folder? because I dont have one, and my ints all say class8.“info here” so do change all those to itemdef.? lol my last question, for the item.cfg, whats the format for that, like all the numbers, what means what? and that should be all my questions…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding models
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

First you Extract the .rar and what you get should be a .dat put that in your cache in the folder named Models or Raw.

Then you go into you Client files and go into itemdef.java, You will need the ints which will most likely be provided with the model.

Last step add the item in item.cfg and adjust the bonuses etc

Read full topic
